questions.question: Relation $R$ is defined as $R = {\ (\ a, b )\ \mid (\ a - b )\ = k_{m}$ for some fixed integer m and a, b, k \in z \} $, then $R$ is
A relation $R$ is said to be circular if $aRb$ and $bRc$ together imply $cRa$. Which of the following options is/are correct?

answers.a: If a relation $S$ is transitive and circular, then $S$ is an equivalence relation.
answers.b: If a relation $S$ is reflexive and symmetric, then $S$ is an equivalence relation.
answers.c: If a relation $S$ is reflexive and circular, then $S$ is an equivalence relation.
answers.d: If a relation $S$ is circular and symmetric, then $S$ is an equivalence relation.

questions.question: Suppose a relation $R = {(3, 3), (5, 5), (5, 3), (5, 5), (6, 6)} on  $S$  = {3, 5, 6}$. Here $R$ is known as

explanations.a: Here, $[3] = {3, 5}, [5] = {3, 5}, [5] = {5}$. We can see that $[3] = [5]$ and that $S/R will be {[3], [6]}$ which is a partition of $S$. Thus, we can choose either ${3, 6} or {5, 6}$ as a set of representatives of the equivalence classes.
